gaps: daemon.ts parseBody()/readBody() has no timeout or size limit on request body reading — slowloris or unbounded payload can hang/OOM the process
daemon.ts orphan sweep setInterval (line 1142) is never cleared on daemon shutdown — interval keeps running until process exit (mitigated by .unref())
daemon.ts URL construction (line 1150) with new URL(req.url!, `http://${req.headers.host}`) can throw if req.headers.host is malformed — no try/catch
daemon.ts and local-api.ts all fetch calls to useai.dev API (sync, publish, auth, username check, cloud pull) have no AbortSignal.timeout — requests hang indefinitely if API is slow or unreachable

daemon.ts sealOrphanFile() and recoverHeartbeat() use non-null assertions on lines[0]! and lines[lines.length-1]! for JSON.parse — though wrapped in outer try/catch, corrupted lines produce unstructured error
register-tools.ts writeJson() calls for milestones/sessions have no retry or fallback — if writeJson fails (disk full, permissions), data is silently lost
session-state.ts appendFileSync (line 319) has no error handling — disk-full or permissions errors throw unhandled, but chainTipHash is not updated on failure so chain stays consistent
mcp-map.ts writeMcpMapping() delegates to writeJson which has no try/catch — if write fails, MCP-to-UseAI session mapping is lost and daemon recovery breaks
dashboard/local-api.ts readBody() has no size limit on request body — unbounded data causes OOM
dashboard/local-api.ts handleCloudPull pagination while-loop has no page limit or total timeout — corrupted pagination headers or slow API causes infinite loop
daemon.ts decodeURIComponent(usernameMatch[1]!) on line 1175 can throw on malformed percent-encoded URLs — no try/catch

violations: Pattern duplication: Tool registry in tools.ts reimplements installStandardHttp, installVscodeHttp, readTomlFile, writeTomlFile, installTomlHttp, readYamlFile, writeYamlFile, installYamlHttp, installCrushHttp — all duplicated in packages/cli/src/services/tools.ts

Large file: daemon.ts at 1442 lines handles HTTP server setup, session management, orphan recovery, stale session recovery, auto-seal logic, dashboard serving, health checks, MCP protocol server, and local API handlers — should be split into focused modules

Large file: dashboard/local-api.ts at 711 lines implements 17+ HTTP handlers spanning data retrieval, configuration, sync operations, authentication, profile management, and data deletion — could be split into domain-specific handler modules
Large file: register-tools.ts at 963 lines embeds all MCP tool definitions and handlers inline within a single registerTools() function plus session enrichment logic — should be modularized
Dead code: getInstructionsText() and getInstructions() in tools.ts are exported but only consumed internally within tools.ts — never imported by any other file across the monorepo

gaps: daemon/ensure.ts findPidsByPort() interpolates port directly into execSync shell command — though port is a numeric constant, the pattern is unsafe if port source changes
daemon/ensure.ts spawn() in ensureDaemon() (line 192) never registers an 'error' event handler — if npx binary doesn't exist, the spawn error event is unhandled
daemon/ensure.ts killDaemon() has race condition between isProcessRunning() check and unlinkSync() on PID file — another instance could restart between check and delete
daemon/resolve-npx.ts resolveNpxPath() interpolates process.env.SHELL directly into execSync (line 51) without validation — malicious SHELL value enables command injection
daemon/autostart.ts installLinux() systemctl execSync at lines 146-147 have no try/catch — if systemctl daemon-reload or enable fails, error propagates unhandled and installation appears to succeed
daemon/autostart.ts installMacos() line 103 execSync for launchctl bootstrap has no try/catch — bootstrap failure crashes the entire setup flow
daemon/check-update.ts fetchLatestVersion() does not validate npm registry JSON response structure — data.version cast with 'as' accepts any string without semver validation
crypto/keystore.ts decryptKeystore() decipher.final() can throw on GCM auth tag validation failure — no custom error message or recovery path
crypto/derive.ts deriveEncryptionKey() calls os.userInfo() which can throw on some systems (e.g. containerized environments) — no try/catch or fallback
crypto/verify.ts verifySignature() calls createPublicKey() without validating that PEM is an Ed25519 key — wrong key type silently accepted (error caught but reason not logged)
utils/fs.ts readJson() catch block returns fallback without distinguishing between 'file not found' and 'corrupted JSON' — callers cannot tell if data file is damaged
utils/fs.ts writeJson() has no try/catch — writeFileSync or renameSync failure propagates unhandled and can leave temp file on disk
hooks/claude-code.ts writeSettings() (line 71) writeFileSync overwrites without backup — partial write failure or crash during write loses entire Claude Code settings
hooks/claude-code.ts installClaudeCodeHooks() catches chmod errors silently (lines 87-88) — hook scripts may not be executable but no verification or warning
validation/schemas.ts date regex /^\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}$/ matches syntactically invalid dates like '9999-99-99' — no semantic date validation
validation/guards.ts hasTimeOverlap() creates Date objects from strings without validating ISO format — Invalid Date comparison silently returns false
utils/config-migrate.ts migrateConfig() uses 'as unknown as UseaiConfig' double-cast — corrupted config passes migration without runtime field validation
constants/paths.ts USEAI_HOME reads from env var without validating the path exists or is writable — empty string silently accepted as data directory

violations: Dead code: exceedsMaxDailyHours(), exceedsMaxContinuous(), isSpikeFromAverage(), hasTimeOverlap() in validation/guards.ts are exported but never imported by any production code across the monorepo — only referenced in guards.test.ts
Dead code: computeLocalAPS() in scoring/aps.ts is exported via barrel but never imported by any production code across the monorepo — only referenced in integration test files
Dead code: verifyChainRecord(), verifySignature(), verifyChain() in crypto/verify.ts are exported via barrel but never imported by any production code — only referenced in verify.test.ts

gaps: commands/login.ts apiCall() fetch (line 9) has no timeout — hangs indefinitely on network failure with no AbortController
commands/login.ts res.json() (line 15) called before res.ok check — non-JSON error response (e.g. HTML 502) throws unhandled parse error
commands/login.ts result.user.id/email/username (lines 98-100) accessed without null check on result.user — partial API response crashes login flow
commands/serve.ts setInterval (line 35) only cleared on SIGINT/SIGTERM — other exit paths leave interval running
commands/daemon.ts spawn() child process has no 'error' event handler — if npx fails to execute, error event is unhandled
commands/daemon.ts health object fields cast with 'as number'/'as string' without validating property existence — unvalidated daemon response causes silent type errors
commands/update.ts no rollback mechanism if daemon fails to update — old daemon killed and tools removed but new daemon may fail to start, leaving broken state
commands/update.ts tool.remove() errors in loop caught silently — user not informed which tools failed to remove
commands/setup.ts checkbox() catch blocks (lines 211-213) return silently on all errors — user interruption handled but other errors also swallowed
commands/config.ts updateConfig() calls not wrapped in try/catch — filesystem errors from writeJson propagate unhandled
commands/purge.ts rmSync with force:true (line 35) suppresses all deletion errors — user told data deleted when it may not be
services/tools.ts readJsonFile() returns empty object for ALL errors — file permission errors treated same as missing file, masking real problems
services/tools.ts writeFileSync calls (lines 89, 200, 255) have no try/catch — if directory not writable, exception is unhandled
services/tools.ts removeInstructions catch blocks (lines 400, 419) are empty — file deletion failures silently swallowed with no logging
services/tools.ts hasBinary() (line 67) interpolates name into execSync shell command without sanitizing — potential command injection if name comes from untrusted source
index.ts program.parse() can throw on async command failures but no global error handler catches unhandled rejections

violations: Pattern duplication: services/tools.ts (762 lines) reimplements the full AI-tool registry, config format handlers (JSON/TOML/YAML read/write), and HTTP install helpers that also exist in packages/mcp/src/tools.ts via @devness/mcp-setup — CLI has no dependency on @devness/mcp-setup

Large file: services/tools.ts at 762 lines combines type definitions, constants, file I/O utilities, 6 config format handler sets, HTTP install helpers, instruction injection logic, tool creation/resolution, 21+ hardcoded tool definitions, and re-injection logic
Naming inconsistency: services/tools.ts does not follow the *.service.ts naming convention used by services/config.service.ts and services/stats.service.ts in the same directory

gaps: No global NestJS ExceptionFilter configured — unhandled exceptions may return raw error details including stack traces to clients in development mode
No request timeout middleware configured — long-running requests hang indefinitely with no protection
No rate limiting on any endpoint — auth endpoints (OTP send/verify) and API key endpoints accept unlimited requests
database/database.provider.ts creates postgres client with no pool configuration (max connections, idle timeout) and no onModuleDestroy hook to close connection on shutdown
database/migrate.ts client.end() only called on success path — if migrate() throws, database connection is orphaned (catch only logs)
auth/auth.service.ts sendOtp() has no try/catch around bcrypt.hash() or database insert — exceptions bubble unhandled with no context
auth/auth.service.ts sendOtp() does not check return value of emailService.sendOtpEmail() — returns successfully even if email sending fails, misleading the user
auth/auth.service.ts verifyOtp() has race condition — concurrent requests between user lookup (line 66) and insert (line 73) can create duplicate users
auth/auth.service.ts uses Math.random() for OTP generation (line 19) instead of crypto.randomInt() — predictable for cryptographic purposes
email/email.service.ts send() fetch to Resend API has no timeout or retry logic — network failure means email permanently lost with no recovery
email/email.service.ts constructor logs warning if RESEND_API_KEY missing but service still created — all subsequent send() calls return null silently
admin/admin.guard.ts uses strict string equality (token !== adminToken) for token comparison — vulnerable to timing attacks; should use crypto.timingSafeEqual()
admin/admin.guard.ts no logging on failed auth attempts — cannot detect brute force attacks
admin/admin.service.ts getDashboard() catch block returns hardcoded zeros on ANY error — masks which query failed, no logging distinction between DB error and empty data
admin/admin.service.ts all list methods (getUsers, getSessions, getMilestones, getSyncs, getAlerts) catch all errors and return empty arrays — no distinction between 'no data' and 'query failed'
keys/keys.service.ts registerPublicKey() deletes old keys before inserting new one (lines 17-22) — if insert fails, old key is permanently lost with no transaction rollback
keys/keys.service.ts validates key with string.includes('PUBLIC KEY') only — accepts malformed PEM that will fail on actual crypto operations
sync/sync.service.ts processSync() check-then-write pattern has race condition — concurrent requests can cause duplicate inserts or lost updates
sync/sync.service.ts updateStreak() reads existing streak, calculates, then writes — concurrent requests can overwrite each other's streak data
leaderboard/leaderboard.service.ts recomputeLeaderboard() deletes all records then inserts without transaction — partial insert failure leaves empty leaderboard
leaderboard/leaderboard.service.ts no distributed lock on @Cron execution — multiple server instances run recompute simultaneously causing data corruption
milestones/milestones.service.ts publish() uses unsafe cast 'as MilestoneInput[]' and no transaction — partial insert failure leaves inconsistent state
common/guards/api-token-auth.guard.ts queries database on every single request for key validation — no caching layer, causes heavy database load under traffic
All controllers use parseInt() for query params without NaN validation or max bounds checking — negative/NaN/excessive values passed to database queries
sync/sync.controller.ts casts request body to Record<string, unknown> with no schema validation before passing to service

violations: Dead code: ZodValidationPipe in common/pipes/zod-validation.pipe.ts is defined with tests (321 lines) but is never applied to any controller route via @UsePipes() or registered globally in AppModule
Inconsistent validation: auth.controller.ts uses manual if-checks (if (!body.email) throw BadRequestException) in sendOtp and verifyOtp routes instead of the project-defined ZodValidationPipe pattern

Incomplete implementation: ProfilesService.getPublicProfile() returns hardcoded empty arrays for top_tools and top_languages despite dailySyncs table containing clients and languages jsonb data that could be aggregated

gaps: lib/api.ts get()/post()/patch()/del() have no timeout on fetch calls — network hangs block UI indefinitely with no AbortController
lib/api.ts post() and patch() silently swallow JSON parse errors with .catch(() => ({})) — error context lost, empty object returned as if success
lib/api.ts del() uses 'error' field for error extraction instead of 'message' like other functions — inconsistent error handling
lib/api.ts postSync() uses Promise.all for fetchSessions/fetchMilestones — single failure stops entire sync with no partial recovery
lib/api.ts postSync() sync batch loop has no retry mechanism — if 5th batch of 10 fails, first 4 already synced with no rollback or tracking
lib/api.ts postVerifyOtp() sets multiple localStorage items without try/catch — QuotaExceededError in private browsing leaves partial auth state
store.ts loadAll() catch block sets loading:false but provides no error state to UI — user sees stale data with no indication that refresh failed
store.ts loadHealth() and loadUpdateCheck() have empty catch blocks — health check failures completely invisible to UI
store.ts deleteSession()/deleteConversation()/deleteMilestone() use optimistic updates that revert on error without user notification — item disappears then reappears
components/ProfileDropdown.tsx AbortController created (line 42) but signal never passed to actual fetch request — request cancellation is dead code
components/ProfileDropdown.tsx debounceRef timeout not cleared on component unmount — late setTimeout callback fires setState on unmounted component
components/SettingsPage.tsx structuredClone(c) called without null check on config — null config from failed load crashes component
components/SettingsPage.tsx error toast setTimeout (3s auto-clear) not cancelled on unmount — triggers setState warning on unmounted component
components/EvaluationStatsBar.tsx requestAnimationFrame-based animateCounter never cancelled on unmount — memory leak and wasted CPU cycles
No runtime schema validation on any API response — TypeScript interfaces provide no protection against malformed data at runtime

violations: Type duplication: lib/api.ts locally defines SessionSeal, Milestone, SessionEvaluation, and LocalConfig interfaces instead of importing from @useai/shared — the local LocalConfig has a flat structure (authenticated, email, username, auto_sync) incompatible with the nested CaptureConfig/SyncConfig structure in @useai/shared
Missing dependency: @useai/shared is not declared in package.json dependencies, preventing import of shared types and forcing local type duplication across 4 interfaces

No custom hooks extracted: auth flow (send OTP, verify OTP, sync, logout), API fetching with loading/error state, config draft/saved state management, and debounced username validation patterns are repeated inline across ProfileDropdown.tsx (431 lines) and SettingsPage.tsx (387 lines) instead of being abstracted into reusable hooks

gaps: lib/api-client.ts clientFetch throws Error with only status code — response body context lost, making debugging impossible
lib/api-client.ts res.json() has no error handling for malformed JSON responses — unhandled exception on non-JSON server response
lib/api-client.ts no timeout configured on any fetch call — all network operations can hang indefinitely
lib/auth.ts localStorage.getItem/removeItem not wrapped in try/catch — throws if localStorage disabled (private browsing) or quota exceeded
hooks/usePresence.ts catch blocks are empty — all errors including non-network issues silently swallowed with no logging
hooks/usePresence.ts no timeout on apiFetch calls — component hangs on network failure
store/dashboard-store.ts Promise.all catch swallows error without distinguishing which API failed — stale data shown with no error indicator
store/dashboard-store.ts localStorage.getItem in try/catch but catch is empty — parse/storage errors invisible
store/auth-store.ts JSON.parse in try/catch silently ignores parse errors — corrupted user data quietly set to null with no logging
store/auth-store.ts localStorage.setItem can throw QuotaExceededError — not caught, auth state partially saved
app/login/page.tsx catch blocks treat all errors identically — network errors, JSON parse errors, rate limits all show same generic message
app/login/page.tsx data.user accessed without null check — partial API response crashes login flow
app/dashboard/layout.tsx apiFetch for user profile has no try/catch — network error during dashboard load silently fails
app/dashboard/layout.tsx 100ms setTimeout for auth check is a race condition — hydrate() may not have updated token yet
app/dashboard/settings/page.tsx setTimeout for error clear not cancelled on unmount — potential setState on unmounted component
app/(public)/[username]/page.tsx server-side fetch has no timeout — slow API blocks page generation indefinitely
app/(public)/leaderboard/page.tsx no AbortController for fetch — multiple concurrent fetchLeaderboard calls on rapid remount
components/ProfileDropdown.tsx username check debounce timer not cleared on unmount — API response setState on unmounted component
components/ProfileDropdown.tsx rapid input creates out-of-order API responses — no request cancellation, stale available/taken status displayed
components/TopNav.tsx GitHub API fetch .then(r => r.ok ? r.json() : null) — if r.json() rejects, produces unhandled promise rejection
components/HeroHeading.tsx chained setTimeout animations have no cleanup — unmount during animation fires setState on unmounted component
components/RadarChart.tsx data values not validated for 0-100 range — undefined data key produces NaN in SVG rendering

violations: Dead code: check-err.js references port 3457 but dev server runs on port 3456 (per package.json 'next dev --port 3456') — stale development artifact not referenced anywhere in scripts or source

Large file: Landing page src/app/(public)/page.tsx at 930 lines defines 6 inline components (SkillRadar, TerminalMockup, CopyCommand, ToolChip, ToolMarquee, HeroDashboardPreview), data constants (AI_TOOLS, FEATURES, STEPS, RADAR_DIMENSIONS, DASHBOARD_SECTIONS), and animation variants that should be extracted into separate files

Pattern inconsistency: Policy pages (about/page.tsx 367 lines, privacy/page.tsx 473 lines, security/page.tsx 285 lines, terms/page.tsx 321 lines) share nearly identical page header, section divider, and hud-border card structure but don't use a shared template/layout component — ~1,446 lines of duplicated structure across 74 hud-border instances

gaps: stats.ts parseTimestamp() returns NaN for malformed ISO strings — cached NaN values propagate silently through all dependent calculations (filtering, sorting, metrics)
stats.ts filterSessionsByWindow() creates Date objects from strings without validating ISO format — Invalid Date comparisons silently return false
stats.ts s.evaluation! non-null assertion used after filter but runtime doesn't enforce — changed evaluation structure could crash silently
stats.ts Record<string, number> accumulation for byClient/byLanguage/byTaskType doesn't guard against prototype pollution — keys like '__proto__' from untrusted data could pollute prototype
components/StatsBar.tsx animateCounter() requestAnimationFrame callback doesn't check if component still mounted — throws if element removed during animation
components/SessionList.tsx IntersectionObserver created but sentinelRef.current not null-checked before observer.observe() — null ref causes runtime error
components/SearchOverlay.tsx escape key handler captures onClose in closure — if onClose prop changes between renders, stale callback is invoked
components/SearchOverlay.tsx and TimeDetailPanel.tsx both set document.body.style.overflow='hidden' independently — closing one modal re-enables scroll when other modal still open
components/TimeDetailPanel.tsx computeActivePeriods() silently skips sessions where end <= start with no logging — data quality issues hidden from user
components/DailyRecap.tsx getSessionsInRange() creates Date from s.started_at without validation — invalid ISO string produces NaN, silently corrupting daily metrics
components/RecentMilestones.tsx relativeTime() calls new Date(iso).getTime() without validating ISO string — NaN diff produces wrong relative time display
components/DashboardBody.tsx readLocalStorage() and writeLocalStorage() have empty catch blocks — localStorage failures completely invisible for debugging

violations: Large file: TimeScrubber.tsx at 533 lines and TimeDetailPanel.tsx at 508 lines contain multiple internal helper components (SessionTooltip, MilestoneTooltip in TimeScrubber; ExplanationBlock, CalcRow, ActiveTimeContent, AITimeContent, ParallelContent, StreakContent, SessionList in TimeDetailPanel) that could be extracted into separate files
Unused dependency: clsx is declared in package.json but has zero imports across all source files in packages/ui/src — all conditional styling uses template literals instead

Code duplication: formatDuration() is independently defined in TimeScrubber.tsx, TimeDetailPanel.tsx, SessionList.tsx, and SessionCard.tsx with slight variations (TimeDetailPanel uses different rounding logic comparing against 3600 instead of checking mins < 60) — should be extracted to a shared utility

gaps: lib/api-client.ts fetch() not wrapped in try/catch — network failure throws unhandled rejection with no context
lib/api-client.ts no timeout mechanism on any fetch request — hanging server response blocks UI indefinitely
lib/api-client.ts res.json() error path returns empty object via .catch(() => ({})) — error context silently lost
lib/api-client.ts VITE_API_URL not validated — undefined or malformed env var causes all requests to fail with unhelpful error
lib/use-api.ts no AbortController to cancel in-flight requests on component unmount — setState called on unmounted component causes memory leak
lib/use-api.ts promise chain collapses all error types (network, parse, auth, server) into single err.message — if error is not Error instance, message is undefined
lib/use-api.ts no retry mechanism — single network failure is permanent until user manually navigates away and back
lib/auth.ts parseToken() catch block returns null for ALL errors with no logging — cannot distinguish invalid JWT format from malformed base64
store/admin-store.ts localStorage.setItem() and removeItem() can throw QuotaExceededError — not wrapped in try/catch
store/admin-store.ts reads admin_token from localStorage on init without validating it's a valid JWT — corrupted token accepted silently
pages/dashboard/index.tsx API failure returns hardcoded zero values — user cannot distinguish 'zero activity' from 'failed to load data'
pages/users/index.tsx calls .toLowerCase() on u.username and u.email without null checks — null values from API crash filter function
pages/system/index.tsx health.status === 'ok' uses case-sensitive comparison — API returning 'OK' or 'Ok' incorrectly shown as unhealthy
pages/analytics/languages.tsx Object.entries(breakdown) iterated without validating values are numbers — mixed types from API cause incorrect sorting
pages/milestones/flagged.tsx action buttons (Approve, Edit, Unpublish) have no onClick handlers — buttons appear functional but do nothing
pages/leaderboard/index.tsx 'Recompute Rankings' button has no onClick handler — non-functional admin action
components/shared/data-table.tsx sort function coerces values to empty string with ?? '' — mixed number/string columns sort lexicographically ('10' < '2')
main.tsx has no React ErrorBoundary — any component error crashes entire admin app with no recovery UI
components/layout/topbar.tsx search input has no value or onChange handler — typing has no effect

violations: Dead code: Zustand store in admin-store.ts defines sidebarOpen, filters state and toggleSidebar, setFilter, clearFilters actions that are never called anywhere in the application — only user and clearAuth are destructured
Dead code: Search input in topbar.tsx has no onChange handler or state binding — purely decorative
Dead code: Recompute Rankings button in leaderboard/index.tsx has no onClick handler
Dead code: Three action buttons (Approve, Edit, Unpublish) in milestones/flagged.tsx have no onClick handlers
Unused dependency: @useai/shared is declared in package.json but never imported in any source file — misses shared VERSION, types, and constants
Placeholder pages: users/[id].tsx, analytics/growth.tsx, analytics/tools.tsx are stubs with no implementation — only render placeholder messages noting missing API endpoints
Pattern inconsistency: Uses unicode symbols (◉, ◎, ▣, ◆, ⟳, ▲, ◧, ▽, ⚙) for navigation icons in sidebar.tsx instead of lucide-react icons — lucide-react is not even imported anywhere in the package
Pattern inconsistency: Hardcodes version string 'v0.2.0' in sidebar.tsx line 46 instead of importing VERSION from @useai/shared — shared VERSION is currently '0.7.0'
Incomplete implementation: Recent Activity section in dashboard/index.tsx renders hardcoded 'No recent activity' with no data integration

gaps: main.ts bootstrap() has no try/catch — if NestFactory.createApplicationContext() fails, application crashes without any error logging
main.ts signal handlers call app.close() without error handling — if close() throws, process may not exit cleanly and resources leak
main.ts bootstrap() call on line 18 has no .catch() — unhandled promise rejection if bootstrap fails
worker.module.ts REDIS_PORT defaults to 6479 instead of standard 6379 — likely typo that silently fails to connect to Redis at runtime
worker.module.ts useFactory callback has no try/catch — if config.get() throws, error propagates unhandled during module initialization
worker.module.ts no validation that REDIS_HOST and REDIS_PORT are valid formats before passing to BullModule connection
card/card.service.ts generateCard() has no try/catch — satori() and sharp() failures crash the job processor with no error logging or context
card/card.service.ts fonts array is hardcoded empty — satori rendering without fonts may produce invisible or broken text with no warning
card/card.service.ts no null/undefined validation on data parameter — null data passed to ShareCard causes runtime error
card/card.processor.ts process() method has no try/catch — job processing errors are unhandled by the processor itself
card/card.processor.ts no timeout on card generation — if satori/sharp hang, job hangs indefinitely
card/card.processor.ts no validation of job.data structure before passing to service — invalid data structure silently accepted
card/card.processor.ts TODO comment indicates storage upload is unimplemented — generated cards written to /tmp but never uploaded, callers receive fake path
storage/storage.service.ts upload() has no try/catch — fs.mkdir() and fs.writeFile() failures for permission denied or disk full are unhandled
storage/storage.service.ts key parameter not sanitized — path traversal via '../' in key allows writing files outside intended directory (security vulnerability)
storage/storage.service.ts S3 upload is unimplemented but returns hardcoded success URL — silent failure masquerading as success; callers believe upload succeeded
storage/storage.service.ts fallback to /tmp for missing S3_BUCKET — temporary storage gets cleaned up by OS, cards permanently lost with no warning
storage/storage.service.ts no retry logic — single filesystem failure causes permanent job failure with no recovery
card/templates/share-card.tsx formatNumber() has no guard for NaN, null, or undefined input — produces 'NaN' or throws in template rendering

violations: Configuration inconsistency: Default Redis port is 6479 in worker.module.ts line 16 vs standard 6379 in packages/api/src/queue/queue.module.ts — likely a typo causing connection failures when REDIS_PORT env var is not set

Mixed test frameworks: Uses both Jest (card.test.ts, storage.service.test.ts, card.service.test.ts) and Vitest (card.processor.test.ts) in the same package — other packages use one framework consistently
Dead code: StorageService is defined and exported in storage.module.ts but never injected into CardProcessor which only injects CardService
Dead code: contentType parameter in StorageService.upload() is declared but never referenced in the method body
Pattern inconsistency: main.ts uses console.log for startup logging instead of NestJS Logger used by services in this package and in packages/api
Pattern inconsistency: worker.module.ts and card.processor.ts hardcode string 'render-queue' instead of importing RENDER_QUEUE constant defined in packages/api/src/queue/queue.constants.ts

Incomplete implementation: Satori fonts array is empty (fonts:[]) in card.service.ts so card text rendering uses fallback; S3/R2 upload in storage.service.ts is a TODO stub that logs a warning and returns a mock URL
Missing test infrastructure: Neither jest nor vitest is declared in devDependencies despite 5 test files using both frameworks, and no test script is defined in package.json
Unused dependency: @useai/shared is declared in package.json dependencies but never imported in any source file under src/

journeys.name: MCP session lifecycle (start → heartbeat → end → seal)
steps: AI tool calls useai_start with task metadata
Session state initialized with chain record
Periodic useai_heartbeat calls update activity timestamp
AI tool calls useai_end with evaluation and milestones
Session sealed with Ed25519 signature and moved to sealed directory

journeys.name: User authentication and cloud sync
steps: User requests OTP via POST /api/auth/send-otp
User verifies OTP via POST /api/auth/verify-otp and receives JWT
Client syncs local sessions via POST /api/sync with JWT
Server validates sync payload and persists to database

journeys.name: Dashboard session browsing and filtering
steps: Dashboard loads sessions from daemon local API
User views stats bar with evaluation metrics
User filters sessions by date range via time scrubber
User searches sessions by keyword
User views session details and milestones

journeys.name: MCP tool setup and installation
steps: Detect installed AI tools on the system
User selects tools to configure
Install MCP config entries (HTTP or stdio)
Inject UseAI instructions into tool rules files
Start daemon process for HTTP transport

journeys.name: Public profile and leaderboard viewing
steps: User registers and syncs sessions to cloud
Other users view public profile via GET /api/profile/:username
Leaderboard aggregates and ranks users via GET /api/leaderboard
Share card rendered via POST /api/render/card

journeys.name: Dashboard real daemon data validation
steps: Daemon starts with seeded session and milestone data
Dashboard loads and displays seeded sessions
User applies client and project filters
Stats integrity verified against seed expectations
User deletes sessions and verifies cleanup

contracts.requestSchema: { username?: string, display_name?: string, avatar_url?: string, bio?: string }
